record.title: ORDERS FOR MONDAY, SEPTEMBER 10, 2007
record.narrative:
ORDERS FOR MONDAY, SEPTEMBER 10, 2007 -- (Senate - September 07, 2007)

[Page: S11281]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until 10 a.m. Monday, September 10; that on Monday, following the prayer and the pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed to have expired, the time for the two leaders be reserved for their use later in the day, and the Senate then proceed to executive session, as provided under a previous order.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
